Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    The class GameController is the controller of the game. It implements the interface ActionListener to be called back when the player makes a move. It computes the next step of the game, and then updates model and view.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameController(int size)
      Constructor used for initializing the controller.

      Callback used when the user clicks a button or one of the dots.

      Revert the Game Model to the previously undone state.
      void reset()
      resets the game

      Revert the Game Model back one previous state.
      void writeObject()
      Write the current Game Model to 'savedgame.ser'

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameController

        public GameController(int size)
        Constructor used for initializing the controller. It creates the game's view and the game's model instances
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the board on which the game will be played

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        resets the game

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Callback used when the user clicks a button or one of the dots. Implements the logic of the game
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - the ActionEvent

      • undo

        public void undo()
        Revert the Game Model back one previous state. the undo function will also push the state being undone onto the redo stack

      • redo

        public void redo()
        Revert the Game Model to the previously undone state. Redo will also push the current Game Model onto the undo stack

      • writeObject

        public void writeObject()
        Write the current Game Model to 'savedgame.ser'
